channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: 米国は、イデオロギー、富、仕事、年齢、場所によって12のニュースバブルに分裂しており、世論を把握し、共通の合意を見出すことが難しくなっている。
item.description:
Axios:
The US has splintered into 12 news bubbles based on ideology, wealth, jobs, age, and location, making gauging public opinion and finding common agreement hard  —  - The Musk-eteers: This is a fast-growing, mostly male group who feed off Twitter, podcasts (especially “All-In” and Joe Rogan) …

item.title: スポティファイ、BBC MaestroやSkillshareなどのオンライン講座を開始、音楽、ビジネスなどをカバー、モバイルとデスクトップで英国で実験的に実施（Jon Porter/The Verge）
item.description:
Jon Porter / The Verge:
Spotify launches online courses from BBC Maestro, Skillshare, and others, covering music, business, and more, as an experiment in the UK on mobile and desktop  —  Spotify's UK users are getting access to a fourth category of content to sit alongside its existing library of songs, podcasts and audiobooks: online courses.

item.title: データにこだわるネットフリックスのグレッグ・ピーターズ共同CEOと、タレントとの仕事が大好きなテッド・サランドス共同CEOは、どのように違いを乗り越えてパートナーシップを成功させたのか（Jessica Toonkel/Wall Street Journal）
item.description:
Jessica Toonkel / Wall Street Journal:
How Netflix co-CEOs Greg Peters, who is obsessed with data, and Ted Sarandos, who loves working with talent, overcame differences to make the partnership work  —  As co-CEOs, Hollywood czar Ted Sarandos and data-obsessed techie Greg Peters have gotten the streamer back on track

item.title: フィナンシャル・タイムズのクロードが開発したAIチャットボット「Ask FT」は、FTの記事で学習し、FTプロフェッショナルの一部購読者が利用できる（The Verge）。
item.description:
The Verge:
A look at the Financial Times' Claude-powered AI chatbot Ask FT, which is trained on FT's articles and available to some subscribers in the FT Professional tier  —  The Financial Times has a new generative AI chatbot called Ask FT that can answer questions its subscribers ask.

item.title: 物理的なメディアを愛する映画ファンが、小さな無料図書館のようにDVDを貸し出す「無料ブロックバスター」サイトをアメリカ、カナダ、イギリスに設立した（ニューヨーク・タイムズ）。
item.description:
New York Times:
Film buffs who love physical media have established “Free Blockbuster” sites, which lend DVDs, similar to little free libraries, in the US, Canada, and Britain  —  The neighborhood lending libraries have popped up around North America, offering a nostalgic return to DVDs.

item.title: Xはクリエイターの誘致を推進しているが、クリエイターの中にはXの広告ビジネスのあり方や一貫性のない支払いに対する懸念を挙げる者もおり、その戦略は不透明なままだ（Alexa Corse/Wall Street Journal）。
item.description:
Alexa Corse / Wall Street Journal:
Despite X's push to attract creators, its strategy remains unclear, as some creators cite concerns about the state of X's ad business and inconsistent payments  —  Despite platform's push, many creators say X is still a long way away from becoming a major source of revenue for them

item.title: NBCの『ミート・ザ・プレス』で、ベテランキャスターのチャック・トッドは、NBCニュースがロナ・マクダニエル前RNC委員長を起用したことについて、「信頼性に問題がある」と批判した（マイケル・M・グリンバウム／ニューヨーク・タイムズ）。
item.description:
Michael M. Grynbaum / New York Times:
On NBC's Meet the Press, veteran anchor Chuck Todd criticized NBC News' decision to hire former RNC chair Ronna McDaniel, saying she “has credibility issues”  —  The extraordinary comments on “Meet the Press” revealed tensions in NBC's news divisions over Ronna McDaniel …

item.title: CrowdTangleのブランドン・シルバーマン元CEOとのQ&A：リサーチツールの創業理念、選挙の年に閉鎖を決めたMetaの決断など（Chris Stokel-Walker/Fast Company）
item.description:
Chris Stokel-Walker / Fast Company:
Q&A with ex-CEO of CrowdTangle Brandon Silverman about the founding principle of the research tool, Meta's decision to close it in an election year, and more  —  Meta announced this month that in August it will be closing CrowdTangle, the platform monitoring tool the company bought in 2016.

item.title: アマゾンからの生命線を得たダイヤモンドスポーツの再建は、ストリーミング時代におけるローカルスポーツ中継の新たなモデルを提供するかもしれない（フィナンシャル・タイムズ紙）
item.description:
Financial Times:
How the restructuring of Diamond Sports, with a lifeline from Amazon, might offer a new model for airing local sports fixtures in the streaming era  —  A lifeline to the bankrupt Diamond Sports Group might offer a new model for airing local fixtures in the streaming era

item.title: 情報筋MSNBCのラシダ・ジョーンズ社長、RNCのロナ・マクダニエル前議長を同局の番組に起用する計画はないと社員に伝える（Wall Street Journal）
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
Sources: MSNBC President Rashida Jones tells employees that the network has no plans to have former RNC chair Ronna McDaniel on the channel  —  Cable network head seeks to address employee and talent backlash over appointment of Ronna McDaniel as an NBC News contributor

item.title: パブリック・インテグリティ・センターはなぜ崩壊したのか：幹部の高い離職率、欠陥のある理事会、限られたプログラム資金、戦略的な失策（Richard J. Tofel/Second Rough Draft）
item.description:
Richard J. Tofel / Second Rough Draft:
Why the Center for Public Integrity fell apart: high executive turnover, a flawed board of directors, narrow program funding, and strategic missteps  —  Reflections after talking with former leaders  —  Welcome to Second Rough Draft, a newsletter about journalism in our time, how it …

item.title: ソーススペイン高等法院、テレグラムの利用停止を命令 メディア各社が申し立て（ロイター通信）
item.description:
Reuters:
Source: Spain's High Court orders the suspension of Telegram after media companies complained it was allowing users to upload their content without permission  —  Spain's High Court has ordered the suspension of messaging app Telegram's services in the country after media companies complained …

item.title: SAG-AFTRA会員、声優の賃上げとAI保護を含むTVアニメ新3年契約を批准、95％が賛成票を投じる（Katie Campione/Deadline）
item.description:
Katie Campione / Deadline:
SAG-AFTRA members ratify new three-year TV animation agreements, which include wage increases and AI protections for voice actors, with 95% voting in favor  —  SAG-AFTRA members today ratified the 2023 Television Animation Agreement and the 2023 Basic Cable Animation Agreement with the Alliance …

item.title: ロングビーチポスト紙、非営利団体への組織変更と従業員の組合結成の動きに伴い従業員を解雇、情報源：17人から8人に削減（Christi Carras/Los Angeles Times）
item.description:
Christi Carras / Los Angeles Times:
The Long Beach Post lays off staffers following a switch to nonprofit ownership and amid employees' efforts to unionize; source: staff was cut from 17 to eight  —  The Long Beach Media Guild announced Friday that at least 60% of the bargaining unit received layoff notices shortly …

item.title: ニール・ヤングに続き、2022年にワクチンに関する「嘘」に抗議して削除したジョニ・ミッチェルの楽曲がスポティファイに復帰（Ben Sisario/New York Times）
item.description:
Ben Sisario / New York Times:
Joni Mitchell's music returns to Spotify after she removed it in 2022 in protest of what she called “lies” about vaccines on the platform, following Neil Young  —  Her music has quietly reappeared on the streaming service, two years after a departure over what she called “lies” about Covid-19 vaccines in podcasts.
